oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Evaluating Resource Use in Low Input Systems
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Dedeurwaerdere, Tom
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Breeding and genetics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Work package 5.1 aims at the evaluation of existing accreditation mechanisms and economic approaches related to low-input livestock farming systems and thus of sustainable development processes through a multi-criteria evaluation of the public goods delivered by different production systems, management techniques and breeding innovations. To this end, we are conducting a comparative analysis of approaches to low-input livestock production, based on the multi-criteria assessment of the performances of production schemes in the delivery of public goods.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Dedeurwaerdere, Tom (2011) Evaluating Resource Use in Low Input Systems. Paper at: First LowInputBreeds Symposium on Ethical Consideration in Livestock Breeding, Wagningen, The Netherlands, March 15 and 16, 2011. [Completed]
